Description:
Anton Bruckner. Symphony no. 4 in Eb major (Robert Haas edition, 1936)
Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra; Otto Klemperer, conductor
Recorded live in the Concertgebouw, Amsterdam, 4 December 1947

II. Andante quasi allegretto (14:03)
III. Scherzo. Bewegt - Trio. Nicht zu schnell. Keinesfalls schleppend (27:01)
IV. Finale. Bewegt, doch nicht zu schnell (37:12)

Title: Klemperer and the Los Angeles Philharmonic, 1934
Description:
Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestra; Otto Klemperer, conductor
Concert of 1 January 1934, Civic Auditorium, Pasadena, California

Electro-Vox originally re-mastered this from the original discs, and it was released on CD in the 1990s by Archiphon but seems to have been out of print for many years. It’s Klemperer’s first recording after he fled Europe, his first live recording, and his second and last recording of music by Verdi. (He recorded Desdemona's Ave Maria, from Otello, with Rose Ader in Berlin in 1931.)

Radio announcement (0:00)

Giuseppe Verdi. I vespri siciliani
Overture (0:35)

Radio announcement (The announcer appears to confuse the Fifth and Sixth Symphonies) (8:05)

Ludwig van Beethoven. Symphony no. 5 in C minor, op. 67
I. Allegro con brio (8:51)
II. Andante con moto (16:29)
III. Allegro (26:15) -
IV. Allegro (31:15)

Radio announcement (The announcer pronounces the title peculiarly as “Die Meisterzinger,” e.g., -tsinger.) (41:10) 

Richard Wagner die Meistersinger von Nürnberg
Act I. Vorspiel (42:02)
